title: How to Make Wiener Schnitzel

steps.headline: Place the eggs in a bowl and beat them with a fork until they become fluffy.
Mix the flour with the pepper, onion powder and salt in another medium bowl.
Place the breadcrumbs into another bowl.
Take a cutlet and dip it in the flour, flipping it to coat both sides.
steps.description: Use tongs or a fork instead of fingers to do this.

steps.headline: Dip the cutlet in the egg and then flip it to coat both sides.
Place the floured and egg-coated cutlet into the breadcrumbs and flip it to coat both sides.
Once the cutlet is battered, lay the coated cutlet on a plate.
Repeat the breading steps with the other 3 cutlets.
Heat 1/2" of cooking oil or lard to 350°F (180°C) in a large frying pan.
steps.description: There should be enough oil in the frying pan so that the cutlets float in the oil, not rest on the pan bottom.

steps.headline: Lower the veal cutlets into the hot oil carefully with a spatula to avoid being spattered with hot grease.
steps.description: Fry them for about 3 minutes on each side, or until 	the crust is golden brown and puffy. Depending on the size of your pan, you may have to do this in batches.

steps.headline: Remove the cutlets to a platter lined with paper towels to absorb grease.
steps.description: Let them sit for 2 to 3 minutes to drain any grease.

steps.headline: Serve the cutlets while they're still warm.

text: Place the eggs in a bowl and beat them with a fork until they become fluffy.  Mix the flour with the pepper, onion powder and salt in another medium bowl.  Place the breadcrumbs into another bowl.  Take a cutlet and dip it in the flour, flipping it to coat both sides. Use tongs or a fork instead of fingers to do this. Dip the cutlet in the egg and then flip it to coat both sides.  Place the floured and egg-coated cutlet into the breadcrumbs and flip it to coat both sides.  Once the cutlet is battered, lay the coated cutlet on a plate.  Repeat the breading steps with the other 3 cutlets.  Heat 1/2" of cooking oil or lard to 350°F (180°C) in a large frying pan. There should be enough oil in the frying pan so that the cutlets float in the oil, not rest on the pan bottom. Lower the veal cutlets into the hot oil carefully with a spatula to avoid being spattered with hot grease. Fry them for about 3 minutes on each side, or until 	the crust is golden brown and puffy. Depending on the size of your pan, you may have to do this in batches. Remove the cutlets to a platter lined with paper towels to absorb grease. Let them sit for 2 to 3 minutes to drain any grease. Serve the cutlets while they're still warm.
